items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR adds my stupid package that compares the current and latest NixOS generations and creates a file to let you know if you "need" to reboot or not.

items.title: nixos/radicle: init services

items.content_html:
Description of changes

I've noticed some that some values are not set using mkDefault, especially in case where values differ between the different parts of netbird. This happens for example when only using the nginx for the dashboard while the rest is using another host as a reverse proxy.
Another thing that is kinda suboptimal is the Stun and Turn config. Since they are using lists, they may not merge as expected, meaning they don't merge at all currenly. I've not yet found a way how to make this both easy to setup, with good defaults, while also allowing changes, without having to redefine the whole list.
Lastly, I put acme in a mkIf since otherwise the attrset will be empty but exist, which fails some assertions in the acme module.

I've added myself as a maintainer since I plan to keep using this module and would like to help keep it updated, but I'm not hard on that if you want to skip the hassle of multiple maintainers, that's fine by me.

Things done

items.title: nixos/espanso: fix espanso options

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Closes: #315158

podman provides a systemd-user-generator binary that is named quadlet.
This binary should be made available in systemd's search path (/etc/systemd/user-generators), which we don't currently link and the PR is aiming at changing that, effecting in podman rootless quadlet containers to start working.

I wonder if I should split this PR ü§î.

items.title: nixos: Don't set `!allowSubstitutes`

items.content_html:
Single unified env file read by systemd

Description of changes

Current settings option requires multiple files if you want to set multiple environment secrets, as well as being read by the service program, meaning that things like agenix won't work with the default service user.

Added a settingsFile option that allows a single secret file, and doesn't break any current behavior for existing settings options, and plays well with agenix. Env variables can be set in both settings and settingsFile.

Tested both the webservice, and the healtchecks-manage script created by the module.

Things done

items.title: nixos/healthchecks: add settingsFile option

items.content_html:
There was a typo that misspelled /etc/ as /etx/

Description of changes

There was a typo that misspelled /etc/ as /etx/ this commit just fixes that

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 24.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.11 and 24.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

items.title: nixos/xdg/portal: Fix typo
